title: AntiFake Tool Developed to Defend Celebrities Against AI Deepfakes
originSummary: The research team at Washington University is working on a tool called AntiFake to fight against deepfake abuses.
AntiFake disrupts audio signals to confuse AI models and prevent the creation of realistic voice clones.
Other methods like digital watermarks and examining word-to-mouth synchronization can help detect deepfakes, but they have limitations and may only work on published content.

title: The Godfather of A.I. Expresses Concerns About its Limits and Potential Harm
originSummary: Geoffrey Hinton, a renowned computer scientist in the field of artificial intelligence (A.I.), expresses concerns about the potential harm of A.I. surpassing human capabilities.
Hinton's research focuses on neural networks and he acknowledges the significant advancements made by A.I. systems like OpenAI's ChatGPT and Google's Bard.
Despite his concerns, Hinton maintains belief in the transformative capabilities of A.I. and its potential to revolutionize society.
The article also provides insights into Hinton's personal life and family background.
Yann LeCun, another prominent figure in the A.I. community, shares background information on Hinton and highlights his success in the field.
The article delves into different approaches to A.I., discussing both the potential benefits and dangers associated with its development.
It explores the challenges involved in creating advanced A.I. systems and offers perspectives from both Hinton and LeCun on the risks and future of A.I.

title: Google sues scammers using fake AI ads to target small businesses
originSummary: Google has filed a lawsuit accusing scammers from India and Vietnam of using fake ads to deceive small business owners into downloading malware that steals their social media passwords.
The scammers are using Google's Bard AI chatbot as bait, even though it is a web-based platform that cannot be downloaded.
This scam is exploiting the rising popularity of artificial intelligence tools to target unsuspecting victims.

title: Google Considers Investing in Character.AI to Boost Chatbot Training
originSummary: Google is contemplating making a substantial investment in AI startup Character.AI to aid in training chatbot models.
The investment may take the form of convertible notes and build upon the current partnership between Google and Character.AI.
Character.AI, created by former members of Google's DeepMind AI project, has already secured $150 million to develop chatbots inspired by fictional and historical figures.

title: AI to "Turbocharge Winners" Faster Than Expected, Predicts MIT Research Scientist
originSummary: Andrew McAfee, a principal research scientist at MIT, advises CFOs to adjust their risk tolerance in order to effectively implement generative AI.
Waiting to see what other companies do in regards to generative AI may result in long-term decline for companies.

McAfee believes that generative AI will separate winners from losers and will have a faster impact on winners than anticipated. He encourages CFOs to embrace generative AI and learn from the "geek way" of running a company.

title: Mastering the Generative AI Mindset: The Key to Success in the Age of Innovation
originSummary: Generative AI is a transformative technology that will separate businesses based on their ability to leverage its potential.
Success in utilizing generative AI requires adopting a mindset that sees AI as a tool to enhance human abilities, rather than replace them.
The mindset includes qualities such as adaptability, curiosity, continuous learning, collaboration, ethical awareness, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

title: Curtiss-Wright introduces rugged computer server for AI at the edge
originSummary: Curtiss-Wright Corp. Defense Solutions Division has introduced an enhanced version of its PacStar 451-NR computer server module designed for edge-deployed AI and 5G communications acceleration applications.
The rugged server includes Intel Xeon D-1700 processors, high-speed NVMe data storage, and IPMI for remote management.
When combined with Curtiss-Wright's IQ-Core Software, the module enables faster deployment of applications at the edge, even in disconnected, intermittent, and limited environments.

title: AI Poses Greatest Job Threat in Washington, D.C. Compared to Rest of U.S.: Study
originSummary: Washington, D.C. is deemed to have the highest risk of job loss to AI compared to other parts of the United States, according to a study by Salarship.
California, Texas, and Florida have the highest number of jobs at risk in absolute terms, while Washington, D.C. has the highest percentage of jobs under threat.

The high concentration of bureaucrats in the capital city makes it particularly susceptible to AI, with office and administrative positions being seen as the most vulnerable to automation. Puerto Rico, Florida, Delaware, and Arizona also rank high in terms of the percentage of jobs at risk.
